author: Staff Reporter
text:
The State government on Friday informed the Madras High Court that it is scrupulously following the judgments of the Supreme Court and the High Court to protect water bodies and that regularisation of encroachments on water bodies in the State is forbidden.

The Deputy Secretary of Revenue Department made the submissions through an affidavit two days after the court said that it would have to quash a Government Order (GO) in respect of regularisation of encroachments made on water bodies, if the government failed to take a stand on the issue.

The court made the observation in view of a Full Bench order dated December 15, 2015 which has banned regularisation of such encroachments.

PIL plea

The issue pertains to a Public Interest Litigation (PIL) petition moved by the Sivakasi Region Tax Payers Association seeking to quash the GO.

The revenue official submitted that the Special Commissioner and the Commissioner of Land Administration had already instructed all District Collectors to restrain from issuing site patta regularising encroachments on water bodies.

Hence further regularisation of such encroachments in the State is forbidden.

The First Bench of Chief Justice S.K. Kaul and M.M. Sundresh, the Bench said, “On perusal of the affidavit we are satisfied and no further directions are required. Petition disposed of.”

Collectors told

not to issue site patta for regularising encroachments
title: Complying with court order on protecting water bodies: govt.
